title: Get out of Jail free card.
body:
All Bronze players (including me..) believe that they don't belong in bronze and that their skill is so much greater than where they are ranked, and they are only there because of bad luck, and in some cases this is true, and in others it isn't. 

So I propose a 'get out of jail free card' After you have played for X number of seasons, you get a 1 time only card that automatically jumps you up to mid silver, then if you can stay in silver (or even rise) then it was fair, the bronze player base was holding you back, and if you fall back into bronze, well then you can rest assured that yes you are a bronze level player, and can no longer complain that its anything other than themselves thats holding them back. 

I personally have gotten mid silver before (of course now the season reset and i have to do it all over again....), but this season i have had the most abominable luck (i know you're all thinking 'oh yea he just sucks and is blaming everything but himself' and ill admit I'm not the greatest player. But i swear! the bad luck i have had in ranked this season is unreal O_O) So it does happen (but i am aware that every bronze player thinks the same.) 

but that is my idea anyway, it gets anyone who shouldn't be in bronze a chance to escape the hellish teamwork down there, and it gives people who think they are better than they are a good wakeup call. 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

replies.body:
To me this idea seems to look to make silver the new bronze. If you have been playing for x number of seasons (assuming x is more than 2), if you aren't out of bronze you probably still need to be improving some of your skills a bit.

Bronze is hard af to get out of, with bad players, troll picks and teams that wont communicate.The thing is, it doesn't magically get better the higher rank you get. You will still get afks/intent feeders/potatoes in mid-silver +.

I have been in bronze in all three seasons that I have played the game. Season four I was even placed in bronze 5, but managed to get out after taking a month of ranked to cram my head full of game knowledge and practicing mechanics in customs and norms. It just takes a lot of dedication to get out. 

You best friend in this instance is probably dyanmic queue. Even though everyone is complaining about it, you should still use it while you can. Get a team together (or even just a duo) of trustworthy people that you know wont afk or feed, and climb out. If you are surrounding yourself with other players that "are better than bronze and play at a mid-silver level", it shouldn't take you that long to get where you think you should be.

I have gotten to mid silver last season, the season before that i got b1, but had ark's in every promo, but this season it puts me straight back into the bottom of bronze.

I legit have done everything you suggested, and it works, but I'm sick of spending the whole year working my way back up to be at the same position i was at last year just to be placed at the bottom again next season.

okay, you are in bronze for a reason. I am plat3 and i just spent a few days playing some games in bronze and i won every game. people don't get stuck in ranks because of noob teams, here is some logic to prove it.

Lets assume you are never going to be the person that makes your team lose (trolling, feeding, afk, etc) that gives your team 4 chances of getting a troll. But since the enemy team is guaranteed to not have you on their team, they have 5 chances. So by this logic, you will win more games due to afk/trolls than you will lose. If you are good enough to be a higher rank, over time you will climb to it

Having a 'get out of jail free card' will do nothing but make silver a worse rank.
You're bragging about getting out of bronze easy when you're platinum? 3 whole tier's above that skill level.. and you're bragging? you serious?
I'm not bragging, im telling you if you are better than your rank you will climb
Put it this way, put pro players like bjergsen,faker etc in bronze. I assure you that they would climb out of it and get back to their rank that they belong in.

you get out bronze because of luck, not skill, unless your some plat or diamond smurf bragging about how you beat players three teirs below you by using some cheese tactic that would never work in your own elo,but for the average bronze player its basically a roulette wheel.
The team factor only starts to play a part in gold. Anyone can climb out of bronze with raw mechanics alone.

Its so easy to climb out of bronze to at least silver 5. Every season im put in bronze and i manage to climb to at least silver 2. In the preseason i even got to gold 4. Its just about how much time and effort you're willing to put in. If you're actually good then pick a hard carry champ like TF, Yi, or Lucian and just stomp everyone. Season 3 i was bronze 3, season 4 silver 4, season 5 silver 1-gold 4. Hopefully when i have more time to play i can climb to gold 1 or even break to plat. Every season i can see improvements but you need to start playing to IMPROVE. The problem with bronzies is that they blame everything on their team instead of looking at themselves. 90% of you dont even know how to play the role properly or why the roles exist in the way that they do. ADC is more than just 'do damage to ppl', support is more than just 'die for the adc', jungle is more than just 'ganking lanes', mid is more than just 'dicking on and outplaying your laner' and top is more than just 'an island'. If you say that getting out of bronze is all luck then you have a defeatist mentality and will stay a loser for the rest of your life. Im not trying to be a dick, but that's brutal honesty for you.
